meanings.definition: Dehisces: (of a fruit or seed) burst open to release its contents.
meanings.sent1: The ripe fruit dehisces to scatter its seeds.
meanings.sent2: When the flower dehisces, it spreads its pollen.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel caused the fruit to dehisce, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The bursting piñata dehisces with candies flying everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The bursting water balloon dehisces, drenching everyone nearby.

meanings.sent1: After the surgery, the wound dehisces slightly.
meanings.sent2: The deep cut on his arm dehisces and requires stitches.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed suitcase dehisces open, spilling clothes everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge dehisces under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent5: The dam dehisces, causing a sudden flood downstream.
